page.title: 11Water Adventure Centre
page.content: The Water Adventure Centre on the Ashton Canal at Fairfield has been open since 1982. Over 600 people come every year.Most of them are boys and the activities that they do are canoeing,gorge walking,mountain walking,tyrolean traversing,woodwork, candle making and rock climbing. They have 54 canoes and 2 rowing boats. There are 6 people employed there. It costs 25p a year to be a member.They go practising in the Wright Robinson High School swimming pool in little canoes called 'bats'. The decorating inside the centre cost Â£10,000. The people who go to the centre are aged between 8 and 21 years old. When the centre first opened it was used mostly by boys so they started a mixed session and a girls only. All the members enjoy the activities and sports.
